content: We've talked about the possibility of inviting someone from the Classic Press project to join with us at Backdrop LIVE for some kind of session. I dropped them a short message yesterday and got a quick response that they would be interested in participating in Backdrop LIVE in some manner. We have not discussed any details yet.

I would like to focus on a session in which they talk to us about the reasons that they forked Wordpress, how they structured their project, governance, etc. I am envisioning this as more of a roundtable discussion, where we ask them questions and maybe share some of our own experiences.
However, I can also imagine a session where they demo Classpress and showcase how it is different from Wordpress.
I got some feedback from @jenlampton and sent them an invite. We'll see where this goes.
I just heard back and they are game for a roundtable discussion at Backdrop LIVE.

@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) - I penciled the ClassicPress sessions in on the draft schedule. But they are not yet confirmed. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1HMEgdwhfMcS5H_SJyR1EO1QWq4PJ35M-VpvA_qx36pE/edit#gid=0

Backdrop CMS LIVE - working schedule
Sheet1 <a href="https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/usa/san-francisco">San Francisco</a>,<a href="https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/usa/new-york">New York</a>,<a href="https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/germany/berlin">Berlin</a>,<a href="https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/austra...
We are also looking at scheduling a basic Intro to Backdrop discussion in Spanish and one in Hungarian. I am speaking with potential volunteers for both about the details.
It looks like I might not get much work done on Friday.
Same here @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) :sweat_smile:
